data: VASC First Rib Resection - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue VASC Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Assess neurovascular status upper extremity, q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then QID if satisfactory
Bilateral pedal pulse assessment q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hour then BID. Start on arrival to recovery room
q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 4 hour then BID. Start on arrival to recovery room
Clamp hemovac for one hour on arrival to PACU then unclamp for two hours and repeat. Strip hemovac PRN
Location Left, Type Chest tube, Suction  -20 cm H20 suction , Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system, Ambulate With Suction No, water seal/no suction
Location Left, Type Chest tube, Suction  -40 cm H20 suction , Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system, Ambulate With Suction No, water seal/no suction
Location Left, Type Chest tube, Suction No suction, Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system, (to gravity), Ambulate With Suction No, water seal/no suction
Location Right, Type Chest tube, Suction  -20 cm H20 suction , Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system, Ambulate With Suction No, water seal/no suction
Location Right, Type Chest tube, Suction  -40 cm H20 suction , Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system, Ambulate With Suction No, water seal/no suction
Location Right, Type Chest tube, Suction No suction, Device Pleur-Evac Sahara drainage system, (to gravity), Ambulate With Suction No, water seal/no suction
Chest Tube safety equipment to be kept with patients at all times
Site: Surgical Site, Reinforce PRN, Leave dressing on for 48 hours unless otherwise directed
Site: Surgical incision(s), Reinforce PRN, Leave dressing on for 48 hours unless otherwise directed
Site: Observe all surgical incision(s) / chest tube(s) / hemovac drain site(s) qshift
Site: Hemovac drain, Change dressing qDaily, Change dressing PRN, Reinforce PRN
81 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab-EC, start: T+1
300 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab
75 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, start: T+1

T;N, STAT, Reason: First Rib Resection Post Operative, Special Instructions: Portable. On arrival to PACU, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Other (please specify), Other Portable Reason: Post Operative in PACU
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
q1h for 4h, then q4h if stable for 24 hour, then vitals QID when stable
T+2;N, Leave dressing for 48 hours unless otherwise ordered
Dressing must be changed prior to discharge
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Complete the VASC Post Operative Pain and Symptom Management PowerPlan (if POPS not involved)
3.75 mg, PO, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab
3 mg, sublingual, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab-sublingual
6 mg, sublingual, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab-sublingual
9 mg, sublingual, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab-sublingual
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
T+1;0600, Timed, Reason: First Rib Resection Post Operative Day 1, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Other (please specify), Other Portable Reason: Post Operative Day 1
T+1;0600, Timed, Reason: Chest Tube, Special Instructions: Daily XR Chest until Chest Tube discontinued, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Requires constant monitoring/observation
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 94% or greater
